thag4.11:1.1: When the crane with its beautiful white wings,
thag4.11:1.2: startled by fear of the dark thundercloud,
thag4.11:1.4: then the River Ajakaraṇī delights me.
thag4.11:2.1: When the crane, so pure and white,
thag4.11:2.2: startled by fear of the dark thundercloud,
thag4.11:2.3: seeks a cave to shelter in, but can’t see one—
thag4.11:2.4: then the River Ajakaraṇī delights me.
thag4.11:3.3: that adorn both banks of the river,
thag4.11:4.1: Rid of snakes, that death-mad swarm,
thag4.11:4.3: “Today isn’t the time to stray from mountain streams;
thag4.11:4.4: Ajakaraṇī is safe, pleasant, and delightful.”
